text: is a former Japanese football player and manager. ==Playing career== Mase was born in Mie Prefecture on October 22, 1973. After graduating from Nippon Sport Science University, he had a brief field career from 1997 to 2000, being in North-Central American teams and living a certain period in Croatia. ==Coaching career== After being translator for Ivica Osim and his son Amar Osimwww.sponichi.co.jp during his spell as JEF United Chiba's coach until 2007, Mase became a coach at the club. Form 2010, he became a coach at Fagiano Okayama (2010-2012) and Tokyo Verdy (2013). In January 2015, he became the manager at Blaublitz Akita.Blaublitz Akita In 2017, he moved to Ehime FC. However the club results were bad in 2018 season, he was sacked by Ehime FC on May when the club was at the 20th place of 22 clubs. In July 2018, he signed with former club Blaublitz Akita and became a manager for the first time in 2 years.Blaublitz Akita ==Managerial statistics== Update; June 30, 2020J.League Data Site {| class="wikitable" style="text-align: center" !rowspan="2"|Team !rowspan="2"|From !rowspan="2"|To !colspan="5"|Record |- !G!!W!!D!!L!!Win % |- |align="left"|Blaublitz Akita |align="left"|2015 |align="left"|2016 |- |align="left"|Ehime FC |align="left"|2017 |align="left"|2018 |- |align="left"|Blaublitz Akita |align="left"|2018 |align="left"|2019 |- !colspan="3"|Total |} ==References== ==External links== * *Profile Category:1973 births Category:Living people Category:Nippon Sport Science University alumni Category:Association football people from Mie Prefecture Category:Japanese footballers Category:Japanese football managers Category:J2 League managers Category:J3 League managers Category:Blaublitz Akita managers Category:Ehime FC managers Category:Association football forwards
title: Shuichi Mase
